channel.title: Svchost
channel.description:
I have a laptop with 2GB of RAM. It currently runs Vista (going to reinstall Arch today/tomorrow). Now I know Vista is a memory eater, but while typing this I have 77 processes running, which take 1.12GB of RAM. And the only program I'm running is FireFox. To top it off, I have 2 svchost processes running, which have a cumulative peak of 250MByte RAM and a normal of about 150MByte.
So what the hell is this? Malware? Is Vista the malware? Or is this Normal?
This shit gave me the final push towards Linux, but I still need Vista for games so I'll keep it as a dual boot.

item.title: Svchost
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

[quote=“la­wl, post:9, topic:267213”]get process explorer (google it) then check each svchost and see what directory its in (double click process, go to image)

if its not in C:\WINDOWS\system32, most likely its malicious

also whats up with task manager saying SYSTEEM?[/quote]

I’ll check it out tomorrow.

And io9 is right, I’m Dutch.

Read full topic

if its not in C:\WINDOWS\system32, most likely its malicious

also whats up with task manager saying SYSTEEM?[/quote]
He’s Dutchie/Norsey/Etcey.

item.title: Svchost
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

get process explorer (google it) then check each svchost and see what directory its in (double click process, go to image)

if its not in C:\WINDOWS\system32, most likely its malicious

also whats up with task manager saying SYSTEEM?

Read full topic

item.title: Svchost
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

You could try using process explorer to see what’s eating all the ram.

Read full topic

item.title: Svchost
item.dc:creator: @Cheese_Police c|p
item.description:
@Cheese_Police wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:6, topic:267213”]A screenshot of my taskmanager. 12 separate svchost.exe’s. 125.328 Kb.

That can’t be right, can it?

[/quote]

why wouldnt it be?

each svchost process is a child of the services process, each does shit for some service that is running.

Read full topic

item.title: Svchost
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

Check your startup list because some adware injects dlls into that process.

Read full topic

item.title: Svchost
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

adware usually hyjacks that shit and increases memory until the point your computer resets, or eats cpu. svchost is a high target, personally i’ve had this happen to me due to some dealio adware shit i have no idea how that got on my system. (probly during an installation i didn’t pay attention and it said, “since this app is free bla bla wanna install bla bla to support us” and i just spammed next.

Read full topic

item.title: Svchost
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

I usually have 6-7(XP) but they never use more than 60-70mb of RAM.

Read full topic

item.title: Svchost
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

svchost is a host process for running Windows services. Most version of windows comes with a fuckton of them installed, an the place that sold you the computer probably added a fuckton more. Open services.msc and you can mess with them.

You’re lucky you only have 2; I’ve seen computers with like 30+

Read full topic
